channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blocked below road level, 5th December
item.description:
I reported this blocked drain in July, and then again in October. It looks superficially clear in dry weather, but is blocked below the road level. This is highlighted by the burst water main today (which I reported to Thames Water) - you can see the outline of the grille in one photograph, but no water is going down it; it’s all flowing to the drain outside 17/15 Goodhart Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Goodhart Way, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing unclaimed domestic rubbish bins, 5th December
item.description:
Two bins have been situated on the pavement on the south side of Delafield Road between Sundorne Road and Inverine Road for over 6 months. They do not appear to belong to any household and are now the collecting site for dog fouling bags and other rubbish, particularly on football days.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delafield Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lynton road towards brondesbury road, 5th December
item.description:
Street never gets sweeped, two bottles have been there for weeks along with other debris. Lots of clothes wrapped amongst leaves (so leaf sweeper leaves them) have been there for weeks since previous fly tipping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lynton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags and boxes being dumped, 5th December
item.description:
Every week, someone or several people dump their rubbish at the end of the road exiting the hospital onto Shaftesbury Road. The rubbish lorries have been down the street today, but did not collect this. A collection and advice or support on sorting this out would be appreciated. Because the foxes rip the bags apart, the rubbish on the street has been picked up by residents three times already this week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shaftesbury Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Large ponding water adjacent Bus Stop K in Westmoreland Road, 5th December
item.description:
